page.title: 11Farming
page.content: Local farms cover all aspects of farming. There are arable, dairy and mixed arable and dairy farms. Milking herds are mostly Freisian, and one or two farms have sheep as well as cattle. There are cash crops of potatoes , barley, wheat roots and rape. A large proportion of the farms are rented from either the Church Commission, or an Estate and pass on from generation to generation. Farms are now largely mechanised, and are worked by the farmer and his family, with very little hired labour. There is an Agricultural Contractor in the area, and the farmers who do not own large specialised equipment, use his services.
